thread.title: ‘Go beyond Victoria Falls,' urges Premier Holidays
thread.title_full: ‘Go beyond Victoria Falls,' urges Premier Holidays

title: ‘Go beyond Victoria Falls,' urges Premier Holidays
text:
‘Go beyond Victoria Falls,' urges Premier Holidays 21 August 2015 | By Edward Robertson Save 
Premier Holidays has launched its 2016 Southern Africa brochure which features a new Beyond Victoria Falls section. 
Product manager John Parker said the section featured four additional properties and was designed to allow travellers to penetrate further into Zimbabwe and Zambia. 
Elsewhere there is a new Blue Train trip from Pretoria to Kruger while two new tours consist of a self-drive through Cape Town, the Garden Route and the Eastern Cape and a three-night escorted tour of Namibia’s Etosha national park. 
Parker added the brochure, which is eight pages bigger, also focused on the actual experiences available to help agents sell them. 
He said: “Our new 2016 Southern Africa brochure is even better this year, and has been designed to enhance the options available for agents. 
“We wanted to produce a brochure that includes all the relevant tools so that agents can help to plan a holiday with their clients, and we believe our new Southern Africa brochure has achieved this.” 
To celebrate the new programme, Premier is offering agents the chance to win a South African wine hamper by answering three questions in the South African trade section of its website by September 3.
